outputs.output_descr: The Civil Society Empowerment Project aims to addressing the challenges and constraints that limit the ability of Civil Society Organizations in Mozambique to play a more active role in the development process and policy dialogue with the Government. The project supports the capacity building of Civil Society Organizations to effectively participate in the governance processes monitoring, especially the to monitor the implementation of the MDGs and the Poverty Reduction Action Plan, through active  participation in the policy dialogue forums with Government and other  development partners at national, provincial and distrct leves. The project will also support in improving the CSOs capacity to analyze policies based on research evidences for further strengthen their participation n the governance processes monitoring. In order to facilitate the work of CSOs in Mozambique the project will assist in reviewing the CSOs legal framework which currently does not provide an enabling environment for CSO activities.

project_descr: Involvement of civil society organizations and structures (including traditional authorities) in the agenda for national and decentralized development is strengthened
